name: DHCP
description: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) automatically assigns IP addresses and network configuration to devices. It operates using a client-server model over UDP ports 67 (server) and 68 (client).
key_topics: DORA process: Discover, Offer, Request, Acknowledge
DHCP lease time and renewal (T1 at 50%, T2 at 87.5%)
DHCP options: subnet mask, default gateway, DNS server
Configuring Cisco router as DHCP server
common_misconceptions: Many training resources state DHCP uses only broadcast. Cisco documentation clarifies that DHCP Offer and Ack can be unicast if the client set a flag, and DHCP relay converts broadcasts to unicast
Third-party materials often confuse lease renewal. Cisco config guides show T1 timer (50% of lease) triggers unicast renewal to original server; T2 timer (87.5%) triggers broadcast to any server
Training books frequently overlook DHCP snooping. Cisco emphasizes this security feature prevents rogue DHCP servers and is critical in production networks
Common error: placing ip helper-address on the wrong interface. It must be configured on the interface receiving the DHCP Discover broadcast, NOT the interface facing the DHCP server
